description: Arnold Schwarzenegger's beginner full-body workout routine designed to build a solid foundation of muscle mass and strength. This program is performed 3 times per week on non-consecutive days.

exercises.tempo_description: 2 sec down, no pause, 2 sec up, no pause
exercises.notes: Focus on full depth and proper form. Go to parallel or below.

exercises.tempo_description: 2 sec down, no pause, 2 sec up, no pause
exercises.notes: Grip wider than shoulder width. Lower bar to mid-chest. Full range of motion.

exercises.tempo_description: 2 sec down, no pause, 2 sec up, no pause
exercises.notes: If unable to do chin-ups, substitute with barbell pullovers or lat pulldowns. Focus on pulling with back, not arms.

alternative_exercise.notes: Lie across bench, lower dumbbell/barbell behind head with slight arm bend

exercises.tempo_description: 2 sec down, no pause, 2 sec up, no pause
exercises.notes: Can be done standing or seated. Press bar straight overhead, lock out arms at top. Don't lean back excessively.

exercises.tempo_description: 2 sec down, no pause, 2 sec up, no pause
exercises.notes: Keep elbows tucked at sides. No swinging or momentum. Strict form only.

exercises.load_guidance: Bodyweight, can add 2.5-10kg plate for progression
exercises.notes: Can substitute with crunches or decline sit-ups. Focus on contracting abs, not pulling with neck.

progression_strategy.description: Add 2.5-5kg to the bar each week when you can complete all sets with good form. For bodyweight exercises, add reps before adding weight.
progression_strategy.deload_frequency: Every 4-6 weeks, reduce load by 10% for one week

warm_up.description: 5-10 minutes light cardio + dynamic stretching + 2 warm-up sets with empty bar or light weight for first exercise

cool_down.description: 5-10 minutes of static stretching focusing on all major muscle groups worked

recovery_guidelines.nutrition: Caloric surplus of 300-500 calories for muscle growth
